channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Sewer cover been moved causing a large gap, 23rd November
item.description:
To the side of flats 15-21 Windermere road near bungalow, noticed sewer cover including concrete has been moved exposing the sewer. Often knocked when council grass cutting.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 23, Windermere Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Subsidence on road, 23rd November
item.description:
Before pedestrian crossing on Hatherley Road as you come to the Alma Road roundabout, there is a large dip sloping to the left, appears to be subsidence. Getting worse over past few months.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 128, Hatherley Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drain flattened, 23rd November
item.description:
Outside no 3 Windermere road. Since driveway made and drain flattened to accommodate this, flooding occurs when raining. Noted drain has flattened more since cars been driven on top of it (curb now raised above drain). Has someone been to review as previous report has been closed with no outcome of the problem??
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Windermere Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pot hole and state of road, 22nd November
item.description:
This section of road has been patched several times. Another pothole has now appeared. Why not do proper job of scraping out a good rectangle of all the separate filling and resurface the patch and be done with it for many years to come.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hucclecote Road, Hucclecote, Tewkesbury

item.title: Full thickness tarmac 50mm deep missing leaving the corner of the cast iron drain cover raised and exposed. Absolutely brutal when a wheel hits iyt, especially with low profile rims when the wheel hits the corner of the drain cover. Drain is also blocked with leaves, 22nd November
item.description:
Corner of Sandy Lane and Greenhills Road, alongside the give way sign on Sandy Lane, see photo

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Sandy Lane, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked drain causing pavement access, 22nd November
item.description:
As previously reported several months ago the same problems still exist. Heavy leaf litter in the gully is blocking the drain. The water regularly blocks access to the pavement for pedestrians, people with prams and those in wheelchairs etc. More regular street cleaning needs to be carried out following the annual autumnal leaf Wallace prior to heavy rains. Photos won't upload unfortunately
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Market Street, St Paulâ€™s, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: No rain in 24 hours - water has increased or remained the same

item.title: Further re-lining required, 21st November
item.description:
Related to ref 7820124, further re-lining required for the approach to Elmbridge Court Roundabout, from Churchdown. I had assumed it would have been completed by National Highways (in November 2025, when they re-painted the roundabout), but previous correspondence with GH and NH clarified to me that there is a clear boundary for jurisdiction, and so presumably GH would 'own' this section of road that leads to the roundabout ? So could you check who owns that strip of road, and arrange for it to be repainted please ? Whilst the lane control sign is still obscured (see separate ticket raised by me), new paint work would really help in clarifying the correct approach lane to use :-) Thankyou !
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road East, Churchdown, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Road marking white lines or studs
